answers.answer: I'd bring that up immediately to your OBGYN doctor. That was one of my first signs of preeclampsia
Definitely call your doctor,  but it seems to me like you had low blood sugar and forgot to eat. I'm 25 weeks and that happens to me if I'm not careful.

I'm 25 weeks as well and get light headed frequently.  I talked to my doctor and they said that right about now is when the baby starts to require a lot more of you and it is not unusual for the light head feeling. My doctor said to stay away from lots of carbs and sugar and to get more protein.  That has helped.

Stay hydrated!! Water water water! Same thing happened to me at work and my doctor got on to me for not sitting down. I'm a ftm so I didn't know what to do. Drink lots of fluid and make sure your eating frequently! My doctor said its very normal but doing these will help make it go away!
Thank you ladies water and a small snack seamed to help a little I will be eating dinner soon to see if that is the reason

question: I'm 24 weeks and all to day I have been getting light headed and sometimes I see like these light specks floating up but know one else sees them has anyone had this
title: help
